snippet: Republicans failed in their attempt to deny free access to preventive care, but may just be helping to inform more Americans about the benefits of health reform.
abstract: Editorial welcomes defeat of Republican-backed Senate measure that would have crippled the expansion of preventative health care in America; notes amendment would have allowed any employer or insurance company to refuse coverage for any activity to which they claim a religious or moral objection; suggests Republicans, by supporting measure, may help inform more people about the popular benefits of health care reform and about the extremism of the party that seems determined to take them away.
lead_paragraph: Republicans failed in their attempt to deny free access to preventive care, but may just be helping to inform more Americans about the benefits of health reform.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
